org.jcvi.jillion.internal.sam

Class SamUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.internal.sam.SamUtil

  • public final class SamUtil
extends Object
    SamUtil is a utility class for working with Sam or Bam encoded data.
    Author:
    dkatzel

        public static boolean isValidKey(char key1,
                                 char key2)
        Assert that the first key character is a valid letter [A-Za-z] and that the second key character is a valid letter or digit [A-Za-z0-9].
        Parameters:
        key1 - the first letter in the key.
        key2 - the second letter in the key.
        Returns:
        true if valid;false otherwise.

      • computeBinFor

        public static int computeBinFor(Range range)
        Calculate the BAM bin for a given Range same as computeBinFor((int)range.getBegin(), (int)range.getEnd()+1);
        Parameters:
        range - the alignment range, can not be null.
        Returns:
        the BAM bin.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if range is null.
        See Also:
        computeBinFor(int,int)

      • computeBinFor

        public static int computeBinFor(int begin,
                                int endExclusive)
        Calculate the BAM bin for a given alignment covering [begin, end) zero based.
        Parameters:
        begin - the begin coordinate zero-based inclusive.
        endExclusive - the end coordinate zero based EXCLUSIVE.
        Returns:
        the BAM bin.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if endExclusive <= begin

      • getCandidateOverlappingBins

        public static int[] getCandidateOverlappingBins(Range range)
        Get an array which contains all the potential BAM bins that the given alignment range overlaps. The contents in the array is not necessarily contigious values and the actual bins used may only be the first few elements in this array depending on the length of the reference.
        Parameters:
        range - the alignment range; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a new array will never be null and will always have at least one element [0] = 0 (which is bin 0).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if range is null.

      • getCandidateOverlappingBins

        public static int[] getCandidateOverlappingBins(int begin,
                                                int endExclusive)
        Get an array which contains all the potential BAM bins that the given alignment range overlaps. The contents in the array is not necessarily contigious values and the actual bins used may only be the first few elements in this array depending on the length of the reference.
        Parameters:
        begin - the begin coordinate zero-based inclusive.
        endExclusive - the end coordinate zero based EXCLUSIVE.
        Returns:
        a new array will never be null and will always have at least one element [0] = 0 (which is bin 0).

      • writeAsBamRecord

        Throws:
        IOException

      • encodeHeader

        public static StringBuilder encodeHeader(SamHeader header)
        Encode the given SamHeader into SAM formatted String (returned as a StringBuilder).
        Parameters:
        header - the header to encode; can not be null.
        Returns:
        the SAM formatted String as a StringBuilder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if header is null.
